metadata.title: CVE-2021-37996 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input Downloads in Google Chrome priorto 95.0.4638.54 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigation restrictionsvia a malicious file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37996` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
